data.value: Bypass patch canceled by user.

data.value: User attempted to select a non-removable drive.

data.name: compPatch_debugNoUSBDrive
data.value: No USB drive selected for patching.

data.name: compPatch_msgFailedEx
data.value: Failed to apply bypass patch:

data.name: compPatch_msgNotRemovableDrive
data.value: The selected path is not a removable drive. Please select a USB drive.

data.name: compPatch_msgSelectDrive
data.value: Select the USB drive containing your Windows 11 installation files.\nThis feature adds a compatibility patch to bypass certain system requirements.\nCompatible with drives prepared by any tool, including Rufus. Ensure the drive is ready!

data.name: compPatch_msgSelectDriveConfirm
data.value: This will apply compatibility bypass settings on the selected USB drive. Continue?

data.name: compPatch_msgSuccess
data.value: Bypass patch applied successfully!

data.name: ctl_FormTitle
data.value: Flyby11 Upgrading Assistant

data.name: ctl_inkCompPatch
data.value: Apply Compatibility Patch to ISO (Clean Install)

data.name: ctl_linkCiuv
data.value: Can I upgrade to Windows 11?

data.name: ctl_linkVote
data.value: Did the upgrade work?

data.name: ctl_statusLabel
data.value: Drag and drop the Windows 11 ISO to patch it and install on unsupported hardware (Inplace Upgrade).

data.name: faq_a1
data.value: A: You can download the latest ISO from the official Microsoft website or use the Fido Downloader.

data.name: faq_a2
data.value: A: If you've successfully installed Windows 11 and saved some money, feel free to leave a little something as a thank-you here.

data.name: faq_a2Link
data.value: Click here to donate and show your support.

data.name: faq_a3
data.value: A: Once the ISO is mounted, the setup process runs in the background. The Windows installer starts, guiding you through the steps required to install Windows 11 on your machine.

data.name: faq_a4
data.value: A: Please check the error messages and report it on GitHub.

data.name: faq_a5
data.value: A: Yes, Microsoft has left a backdoor open. This method leverages a feature of the Windows 11 setup process that uses the Windows Server variant of the installation. Unlike the regular Windows 11 setup, this variant skips most hardware compatibility checks.

data.name: faq_a6
data.value: A: According to Microsoft, you should throw your PC away. I would suggest installing Linux on it and moving away from Windows.

data.name: faq_a7
data.value: A: The developer is Belim, also known as Builtbybel, who has contributed a lot of code to the Windows community.

data.name: faq_a7Link
data.value: Click here to learn more about the developer's work.

data.name: faq_downloadFido
data.value: Download via Fido (Recommended)

data.name: faq_downloadMS
data.value: Microsoft Site

data.name: faq_header
data.value: Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ)

data.name: faq_q1
data.value: Q: Where can I get the latest Windows 11 ISO?

data.name: faq_q2
data.value: Q: How can I support the developer?

data.name: faq_q3
data.value: Q: How does the setup process work once the ISO is mounted?

data.name: faq_q4
data.value: Q: What if I encounter issues during installation?

data.name: faq_q5
data.value: Q: Is it legal to use this method?

data.name: faq_q6
data.value: Q: What are my alternatives if my PC is not supported?

data.name: faq_q7
data.value: Q: Who is the developer?

data.name: ciuView_lblPtAns

data.name: ciuView_lblPtAns2
data.value: 2. The device meets

data.value: 1. Download and run the

data.name: ciuView_lblPtAns4
data.value: 2. Select the following Windows Update shortcut and then select the Check for updates button:

data.name: ciuView_lblPtAns5
data.value: 3. Your device does not meet the official requirements for Windows 11? You can apply a compatibility patch to enable the Inplace Upgrade via Windows Update.

data.value: An existing Windows 10 device can be upgraded to Windows 11 if it meets the following criteria:

data.name: ctl_linkSelectComputer
data.value: Select from computer

data.name: msgClosing
data.value:
Thank you for using my app!

I developed this application in my free time to help you upgrade from Windows 10 to Windows 11 – even on PCs that, according to Microsoft's hardware requirements, would normally not be supported.

My app helps you avoid purchasing a new computer and actively contributes to reducing unnecessary electronic waste.

Normally, I do not charge anything for my projects – neither for development nor for support.
However, since this app is significantly more comprehensive, offers more features, and requires more support, I would be grateful if you would consider making a small voluntary donation, if you are able to.

Of course, only if you want to and can afford it.

Would you like to donate on PayPal now?
